summary: We reviewed U.S. Customs and Border Protection operations during the COVID-19 pandemic. Through Feb. 2021, over 7,000 of its employees reported being infected with COVID-19, and 24 died Over 20,000 employees were unable to work at some point due to COVID-19-related illness or quarantine Employee absences didn't generally have a significant impact at air, land, or sea ports, which saw declining traffic, officials told us...
title: Border Security: CBP's Response to COVID-19
